subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 4.x and support for Java 1.4
msgSnippet: Mark, Would a supported version of JUnit 3.8 meet your needs? Or are there particular features of JUnit 4 or TestNG that you re looking for? Before I jump in
messageBody:
Mark,

Would a supported version of JUnit 3.8 meet your needs? Or are there
particular features of JUnit 4 or TestNG that you're looking for?

Before I jump in with possible solution ideas, I'd like to understand
the problem a little better. :-)

David Saff

Mark Levison wrote:
> Kent (and other JUnit 4 developers) – has any consideration been given to
> support Java 1.4 with JUnit 4.xx. The use of annotations – could be replaced
> with doc comments. Unfortunately some of us work in corporate environments
> where use of Java 1.5 will take at least another couple of years (we only
> just dropped support for Java 1.3). Can you for see support for Java 1.4 are
> must we look to TestNG to fulfill our needs?
> Thanks
> Mark Levison
> ----------------------------------------------------------------------
> Blog: http://www.notesfromatooluser.com/
